Description: A drop-shaped pendant: of light-brown translucent quartz. The surface at the upper end of both faces has been smoothed by rubbing. The perforation was made from both sides.
Curator's comments: Cf. C. M. Firth, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1908-9’ (Cairo, 1912),11, pl.37a, no. 10 (crystal), Early Dynastic, and Sir R. Mond and O. H. Myers, ‘Cemeteries of Armant’ (London, 1928), pl.XLI, 89A7 (crystal quartz), Protodynastic, but see also A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’, Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Mitteilungen aus der ägyptischen Sammlung’ IV (Berlin, 1929), pl.35, no. 838 (rock crystal), Predynastic.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (201)
